Our Reference: EIR/1097/2022

Dear Clare

Request for information

We write further to your request for information dated 25^th March 2022,

which we have been considering under

the Environmental Information Regulations 2004.

We have split your request in 2 parts, we set below each point of your

request followed by our response:

Start and stop times/dates for EDM monitoring equipment for the last 5

years

Please find the EDM spill data provided for Crickhowell SWK.

Information on data availability and the block counted data is given in

Comments which can be found in column L in Request tab,

Annual spill figures have been summarised on Spill Summary tab and spill

block data is provided on EDM spill block data tab.

Spills are reported using the 12/24 block counting methodology and is

described as follows. Our EDM records data every 15 minutes. A “spill” is

triggered when the first 15-minute reading detects a discharge. The first

“spill” in an event can be any number of readings within that first

12-hour period after the first discharge is detected. Any subsequent

“spill number” in an event is measured over the next, and any further

24-hour period. Again, the “spill” can be any number of readings within

that period after the first discharge is detected. Column H in the “EDM

Spill Block Data” tab gives the number of 15-minute reading within the

individual “spill” that were over the spill point.

Including the volumes that were discharged in each event:

We do not record discharge volumes. Our EDM monitoring only records the

number and duration of spill events and does not record the volume of a

spill event.

We hope that this response is clear. Should you have any questions, please

contact us by email at [1][email address]

If you are dissatisfied with the handling of your request, you have the

right to ask for an internal review. Internal review requests should be

submitted within 40 working days of the date of receipt of this response

and should be addressed to Company Secretary, Linea, Fortran Road, St

Mellons, Cardiff CF3 0LT

If you are not content with the outcome of the internal review, you have

the right to apply directly to the Information Commissioner for a

decision.

Yours sincerely,
